sentences.sContent: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.sContent_eng: When a neutron inside an atom decays, it produces a proton, an electron, and a neutrino.
sentences.sCn: 原子内的一个中子衰变后会产生一个质子、一个电子和一个中微子。

sentences.sContent: They have analyzed data collected from the neutrino beam at LNGS and have found no evidence of radiation or electron-positron pairs coming from the neutrinos.
sentences.sContent_eng: They have analyzed data collected from the neutrino beam at LNGS and have found no evidence of radiation or electron-positron pairs coming from the neutrinos.
sentences.sCn: 他们分析了在LNGS所收集到的有关中微子束的数据 ，可是并没有发现来自中微子正负电子对辐射的任何证据。

sentences.sContent: As a neutrino strikes an atom, the energy of the collision warms the immediate surroundings, causing them to expand ever so slightly and trigger a minuscule shock wave of a specific shape.
sentences.sContent_eng: As a neutrino strikes an atom, the energy of the collision warms the immediate surroundings, causing them to expand ever so slightly and trigger a minuscule shock wave of a specific shape.
sentences.sCn: 当一个中微子撞击原子时，碰撞产生的能量会使周围环境受热，使其发生微小的扩张膨胀，并且触发产生一种形状特殊的微型冲击波。

trans.tranOther: something that is smaller than an atom and has no electrical charge
